title: Gwyneth Paltrow trial: Actress denies hit-and-run in ski crash
description: The actress testifies she felt "hurt and violated" when she says a man crashed into her on the slope.

title: Ukraine war: Battle for Bakhmut 'stabilising' - Ukraine commander
description: Despite Russia spending months trying to take the city, Ukrainian officials say they are holding on.

title: Pallbearers of late Queen's coffin recognised in special honours list
description: King Charles formally recognises the roles played by scores of royal aides and military personnel.

title: John Lewis: Mary Portas warns retailer it has 'let go' of its soul
description: In an open letter the retail consultant says the store is "part of our collective cultural identity".

title: Sweden 0-3 Belgium: Zlatan Ibrahimovic breaks record as Romelu Lukaku scores hat-trick
description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic becomes the oldest man to play in a European Championship qualifier as Romelu Lukaku scores a hat-trick to lead Belgium to victory against Sweden.

title: Everton 1-1 Liverpool: Toffees held to WSL draw in feisty Merseyside derby
description: Everton held to a draw by Liverpool in a feisty Women's Super League Merseyside derby at a raucous Goodison Park.

title: France 4-0 Netherlands: World Cup runners-up begin Euro 2024 qualifying campaign with win
description: Kylian Mbappe scores his first goals as France captain as the World Cup finalists begin their Euro 2024 qualifying campaign with a comfortable win against the Netherlands.

title: Derbyshire PC to keep job after using database to find woman on Instagram
description: The panel rules sacking the PC was "not a proportional or appropriate outcome" for his actions.

title: World Match Play Championship: Jordan Spieth out after defeat by Shane Lowry
description: Jordan Spieth is out of the WGC-Dell Technologies Match Play Championship following a 2&1 defeat by Shane Lowry in Austin, Texas.

title: Women's Six Nations 2023: Can professional Scotland close gap to England?
description: Scotland's players have had contracts like England since the end of 2022, but it may be too soon for them to catch up with the Red Roses.

title: Firms hit back at Bank governor in prices row
description: Wetherspoon boss Tim Martin says bank managers are "breathing down the neck" of business owners.

title: Cladding: More firms sign post-Grenfell fire safety contract
description: The agreement commits firms to spending £2bn on repairs to buildings with unsafe cladding or other issues.

title: Person dies in listeria outbreak linked to cheese
description: Three people are affected by the outbreak linked to a Wiltshire firm's Baronet cheese.

title: Olympics: Ukraine accuses IOC of 'double standards' over Russia
description: The International Olympic Committee is accused of "double standards" by Ukraine's sports minister for suggesting Russian and Belarusian athletes could compete at Paris 2024.

title: France protests: Macron takes off 'luxury' watch during TV interview
description: The president's team say the watch was banging on the table - but critics say it was a bad look.

title: Julian Nagelsmann: Why did Bayern Munich sack their manager and turn to Thomas Tuchel?
description: Bayern Munich are the reigning Bundesliga champions and just one point off the top this season, so why was Julian Nagelsmann sacked?

title: Women's Premier League: Issy Wong hat-trick leads Mumbai Indians into WPL final
description: Issy Wong takes a hat-trick and Nat Sciver-Brunt scores 72 as Mumbai Indians join Delhi Capitals in the Women's Premier League final.

title: Julian Nagelsmann: Bayern Munich sack manager and appoint Thomas Tuchel
description: Bayern Munich sack manager Julian Nagelsmann after less than two years in charge and appoint former Chelsea boss Thomas Tuchel.

title: 'A troubled moment' - what is going on at the BBC?
description: The broadcaster is fighting fires on several fronts, but seasoned BBC-watchers are feeling deja-vu.

title: Record revenue for staff agencies supplying NHS
description: Companies thrive as the health service struggles with staffing gaps and increased patient demand.

title: Everton: Premier League refers club to independent commission over alleged breach of financial rules
description: Everton have been referred to an independent commission by the Premier League over an alleged breach of its profitability and sustainability rules.

title: Some lawyers vow to not prosecute climate activists
description: More than 120 lawyers vow to not act against activists from Extinction Rebellion and Just Stop Oil.

title: Israel turmoil dogs Netanyahu's UK trip
description: Protests which are rocking his country cast a shadow over the Israeli PM's flying visit.

title: Liam Holden: Army torture forced murder confession, court rules
description: Parachute Regiment troops tortured Liam Holden into saying he killed a soldier in 1972, a judge rules.

title: Daniel White strangled and slit wife's throat in their home
description: Daniel White kicked open his wife's locked door, strangled her and then cut her throat.

title: Massive asteroid to pass by Earth on weekend
description: The unusually large space object will harmlessly bypass the planet this weekend.

title: Paul Rusesabagina: Hotel Rwanda hero set to be freed
description: Paul Rusesabagina, played in the 2004 movie by Don Cheadle, was credited with saving 1,200 people.

title: Deutsche Bank share slide reignites worries among investors
description: Worries over the financial strength of the sector persist, with Deutsche Bank shares down 14% at one point.

title: Police speak to Premier League player about a further alleged sexual offence
description: A Premier League footballer facing two rape allegations has been interviewed by police about a further alleged sexual offence involving a third woman.

title: Top Gear's chequered past: Crashes, controversy and Clarkson
description: The show has been put on hold following a crash involving host Freddie Flintoff. Will it be back?

title: MPs approve plans to make street sexual harassment a crime
description: A government-backed bill criminalising catcalling or following people now goes to the House of Lords.

title: UK and EU formally adopt new Brexit Windsor Framework deal
description: The Windsor Framework is aimed at improving trade between Northern Ireland and the rest of the UK.

title: Brixton crush victim's funeral held after three-month wait
description: A funeral service for Rebecca Ikumelo goes ahead three months after the crush at the O2 Academy Brixton.

title: Danielle Kang taken to hospital after withdrawal from LPGA Drive On Championship
description: American golfer Danielle Kang is taken to hospital after pulling out of the LPGA Drive On Championship.

title: TV presenter Sophie Morgan in 'rage at the injustice' of Blue Badge theft
description: The TV star says she was "in a rage" at the "injustice" of her Blue Badge being stolen from her car.

title: Lawrence Okolie: Inside cruiserweight world champion's complete overhaul before WBO title defence
description: Lawrence Okolie will have a very different team behind him when he defends his WBO cruiserweight world title on Saturday in Manchester.

title: Leeds United close Elland Road stadium following 'security threat'
description: Leeds United say they have closed their Elland Road stadium "following reports of a security threat to the premises".

title: Netanyahu meets Sunak at Downing Street amid protests
description: Shouts of "shame" and "traitor" can be heard as the PMs meet on Downing Street steps.

title: UK retail sales boosted by second-hand and discount stores
description: Retail sales rose strongly last month as cash-strapped shoppers looked for cheaper options.

title: World Figure Skating Championships: Lewis Gibson and Lilah Fear's rhythm dance routine
description: Watch Lewis Gibson and Lilah Fear's rhythm dance routine that puts them in fourth place before Saturday's World Figure Skating Championships medal decider.

title: King Charles's France visit postponed after pension protests
description: The state visit is called off ahead of a 10th day of national pension protests on Tuesday.

title: 'Who believes Johnson was telling the truth?', TV audience asked
description: Fiona Bruce asks the Question Time audience if they believe the former PM told a committee of MPs the truth.

title: Eurovision 2023: Grand final to be shown in cinemas for first time
description: The grand final on 13 May will be broadcast in 500 cinemas around the UK, it has been announced.

title: Northern lights dazzle in parts of UK overnight
description: Normally rare in southern parts of the UK, the aurora made an appearance for the second time in a month.

title: Man Utd forward Rachel Williams plans to return to plastering after football
description: It was very different when Rachel Williams first started playing football in the women's top-flight almost 15 years ago - but some things never change.

title: BBC suspends proposed closure of the BBC Singers
description: The group, which is the UK's only full-time professional chamber choir, will now perform at the Proms.

title: Ruth Perry couldn't share Ofsted result for 54 days, friend says
description: Lisa Telling says her friend Ruth was "under enormous stress before she died."

title: Wadhurst is named as the best place to live in the UK
description: Judges said the East Sussex town had "pretty much everything needed for modern life in miniature".

title: Cost of living crisis increases fears for small gig venues
description: There are fears that the UK music scene will suffer if grassroots pubs, bars and clubs keep closing.

title: Rahul Gandhi disqualified as Lok Sabha MP after conviction in defamation case
description: India's Opposition leaders held a protest march outside the Parliament on Friday.

title: Harry Kane: England captain reflects on breaking England goalscoring record on 'amazing night' in Italy
description: England captain Harry Kane says it was a "proud moment" for him to break the England goalscoring record.

title: Train Like A Pro: Commonwealth champion gymnast Courtney Tulloch's rings masterclass
description: Liam Loftus catches up with double Commonwealth champion Courtney Tulloch before the British Gymnastics Championships to learn rope climbing, the rings and a backward somersault.

title: Miami Open 2023: Ukraine's Marta Kostyuk refuses handshake with Russia's Anastasia Potapova
description: Ukraine's Marta Kostyuk refuses to shake hands with Anastasia Potapova after being beaten by the Russian in the second round at the Miami Open.

title: Lionel Messi: Argentina & Paris St-Germain forward reaches 800 goals
description: Lionel Messi scores his 800th top-level goal with a free-kick for Argentina in a friendly against Panama in Buenos Aires.

title: Lottery jackpot wins: Is Duleek the luckiest village in Ireland?
description: Two shops in Duleek, which has 4,200 residents, have sold jackpot-winning lottery tickets in six months.

title: Lord Sugar crowns winner of The Apprentice
description: The Apprentice featured an all-female final for the second year in a row.

title: Women's Six Nations 2023: Why women's rugby is booming this year
description: Separation from the men's Six Nations and increasing professionalism - BBC Sport looks at why women's rugby is on the up.

title: Ukraine war: How a Russian child's drawing sparked a police investigation
description: Masha, 12, is now in a children’s home after Russian authorities placed her father under house arrest.

title: Bank warns interest rates will rise again if firms hike prices
description: The Bank of England boss urges firms to avoid price rises that fuel inflation and hurt the least well off.

title: Kim Jong Un oversees launch of nuclear-capable underwater drone - state media
description: Analysts say North Korea's claim it can cause a "radioactive tsunami" should be viewed with scepticism.

title: Claude Lorius: Pioneering French climate change scientist dies aged 91
description: His expeditions to Antarctica helped prove that humans were responsible for global warming.

title: Muslim told not to pray at Canadian train station
description: Ahmed told the BBC of his shock after being told he was "bothering" other customers by praying.

title: BBC local radio hosts win broadcasting award for grilling Liz Truss
description: Eight presenters will share a broadcasting award for their interviews with former Prime Minister Liz Truss.

title: Visitors can walk on rare coronation floor in socks
description: Westminster Abbey will allow access to the spot on a 750-year-old floor where the King will be crowned.

title: School inspections will continue, Ofsted boss says
description: Unions urged a pause after a head killed herself while awaiting a report that downgraded her school.

title: Iraq war 20 years on: 'I lost my leg, but I'd do it again'
description: Two decades on from the invasion, UK Armed Forces veterans reflect on how the Iraq war changed them.

title: Average Treasury worker 34 despite over-50s back to work push
description: Over-50s are being urged to work but just 10% of Treasury staff are that age, the BBC has learned.

title: What are abortion pills and could they be banned?
description: They have become the new frontier in the US battle over abortion access but their future is at risk.
